snippet.title: Quirky North Melbourne townhouse hits the market - realestate.com.au
snippet.content:
, has price hopes of $5.5 million.
A POOL that's both indoors and out, with a mosaic mural of roses on one wall and an "enormous" LED television on another, sets the scene for this quirky contemporary townhouse. "It's half exposed to the elements, but if you were sitting next to the pool it's all covered, so you can use it all year round," Dingle Partners director Anton Wongtrakun said. RELATED:
41-43 Little Leveson St, North Melbourne.
The property spreads across four levels.
The inner-city oasis at , was built with "dramatic, sophisticated" flair, he said. It spreads across four levels, connected by a lift and crowned by a 220sq m rooftop terrace. Its three bedrooms include a lavish main featuring floor-to-ceiling marble, timber wardrobes, a built-in TV and marble fireplace that separates it from a hotel-like ensuite.
It is crowned by a 220sq m rooftop terrace.
There is a lavish main suite.
A 3D home cinema, glass wine cellar, parking for four cars and an open-plan living and dining area complete the residence. The quirky home is being sold privately with a price guide of $5.5 million.
A 3D home cinema and a glass wine cellar are features.
The kitchen is glossy and stylish.
